meanings.definition: To change to an opposite direction or position.
meanings.sent1: She was reversing her car out of the parking spot.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys reversing the order of his daily routine.
meanings.sent3: The magician was reversing the rabbit back into the hat!
meanings.sent4: The decision to move to a new city was like reversing the course of a river.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a mirror to show the students how reversing the image changes its direction.

meanings.definition: To turn something inside out or upside down.
meanings.sent1: He was reversing his socks to find a matching pair.
meanings.sent2: The artist was reversing the canvas to work on the other side.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally ended up reversing the cake while decorating it.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a storm, reversing everything she once believed.
meanings.sent5: The tornado had the power of reversing houses and trees in its path.

meanings.definition: To go back in a reverse direction.
meanings.sent1: The hiker realized he was reversing the wrong way on the trail.
meanings.sent2: The ship was reversing slowly out of the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The cat was reversing playfully around the room.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were constantly reversing back to that moment.
meanings.sent5: The clock seemed to be reversing time, ticking backwards.
